content.subtitle: Your baby is only as big as a poppy seed now! The embryo has two layers of cells, called the epiblast and the hypoblast.

content.title: Sesame seed
content.subtitle: Your baby can be measured at this stage - about 2mm long! The embryo now looks like a small tadpole with a primitive head and tail.

content.title: Sweet pea
content.subtitle: Your sweet pea is the size of a pea! Your baby has curved into a C shape now and has a tail, and looks a bit like a small tadpole.

content.title: Aratilis
content.subtitle: Now measuring around 1cm long, your growing baby is as big as an aratilis, also known as Singapore cherry. He/she has a tiny tail, an extension of the tailbone, that will soon disappear.

content.title: Bengal Currant
content.subtitle: Your baby is the size of a Bengal currant now. His/her nerve cells are branching out to connect with one another, forming early neural pathways.

content.title: Longan
content.subtitle: Now your baby is the size of a longan and is no longer an embryo but a foetus. Yes, a living, breathing, growing baby in your womb!

content.title: Prune
content.subtitle: Your baby is now the size of a prune and already an inch and a half long. He/she is no longer as wrinkly as the week before and has already developed recognisable facial features.

content.title: Lychee
content.subtitle: Your baby is growing fast and is the size of a lychee! He/she is almost two inches long and is more human in his/her appearance.

content.title: Rambutan
content.subtitle: Your baby has more than doubled in size in just the last three weeks and is the size of a rambutan. Most of his/her vital organs are formed already and his/her heartbeat will come through loud and clear this week.

content.title: Star apple
content.subtitle: Your baby is now the size of a star apple and almost three inches long. Lots of subtle developments are taking place in his/her body.

content.title: Guava
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about the size of a guava and will continue to grow rapidly through the course of this week.

content.title: Sugar Apple
content.subtitle: Your baby is as big as a small, sweet sugar apple by the start of this week. By the end of this week, some amazing developments in your little one will be visible if you get a scan.

content.title: Avocado
content.subtitle: Your baby is only the size of a medium avocado this week, but he/she can already kick his/her tiny feet and make grasping motions with the hands!

content.title: Onion
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about a size of a large onion! Have you decided if you want to know your baby's gender?

content.title: Sweet potato
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about the size of a sweet potato! He/she can now perform acrobatic stunts in your womb! Twisting, turning, wriggling, punching and kicking, can you feel that?
The embryo has just formed and at over 100 cells in count, it is barely bigger than a pinprick!

content.title: Banana
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about the size of a banana. You're halfway there now!

content.title: Bunch of grapes
content.subtitle: Your baby is as big as a bunch of grapes. His/her growth is going to double in the next few weeks!

content.title: Papaya
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about the size of a papaya. You'll be feeling more foetal activity at this stage!

content.title: Small Winter Melon
content.subtitle: By now, your baby is the size of a small winter melon. If you're planning to travel, the best time to do so is now.

content.title: Corn
content.subtitle: Your baby is as long as an ear of corn now! Congrats on reaching your 6th month of pregnancy!

content.title: Eggplant
content.subtitle: Your baby now is the size of an eggplant. While he/she is rapidly developing, you might be experiencing backaches, constipation, and hemorrhoids. These symptoms are completely normal so don't worry, you have got this!

content.title: Lettuce
content.subtitle: Your baby is now roughly about the size of a lettuce. Your bump is clearly visible making it harder for you to walk, sit or sleep. But don't let that stop you from doing some light exercises.

content.title: Cauliflower
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about the size of a head of cauliflower. Congrats on nearing the end of your second trimester! Another three more months to go, you are almost there!

content.title: Chinese Cabbage
content.subtitle: Great news -you're now in your third trimester of pregnancy! Your baby is now about the size of a Chinese cabbage. He/she is getting ready to meet you, so expect more ninja kicks than usual.

content.title: Butternut Squash
content.subtitle: Your baby is now the size of a butternut squash. He/she has more fat under his/her skin and looks plumper now than  in the previous weeks. Your little one's brain is now growing rapidly, so taking prenatal supplements is very important!

content.title: Big Pomelo
content.subtitle: Your belly bump is definitely unmistakable at this point! Your baby is as big as a large pomelo. Your little one might be growing in length at a slower pace, but he/she will surely continue to gain more weight in the coming weeks.

content.title: Coconut
content.subtitle: Your baby is getting bigger and rounder and is as big as a coconut now. His/her wrinkled skin is becoming more smooth, making him/her look more like a newborn.

content.title: Rock Melon
content.subtitle: Your baby is as big as a small rock melon this week. Your little one is plump thanks to the fat stored in his/her body. You're almost at the home stretch!

content.title: Baby Pineapple
content.subtitle: Your baby is roughly the size of a baby pineapple. Have you started picking out names yet?

content.title: Cantaloupe
content.subtitle: Your baby is the size of a cantaloupe at this stage. Is your baby's nursery ready yet?

content.title: Honey dew melon
content.subtitle: At this stage, your baby is about the size of a large honey dew melon. It's time to start making plans to go on maternity leave.

content.title: Canary Melon
content.subtitle: Your baby is pretty close to the size of a canary melon. You're in your ninth month now!

content.title: Stalk of Silverbeet
content.subtitle: Your baby is as big as a stalk of silverbeet and is now 'full term' -  your baby could come any day now, and it wouldn't be 'early'.

content.title: Leek
content.subtitle: Your baby is now about as long as a leek! Have you packed your hospital bag yet?

content.title: Mini watermelon
content.subtitle: Your baby is growing fast and is the size of a mini watermelon! He/she has most likely reached his/her birth weight and length. You will be visiting your ob-gyn pretty frequently at this point.

content.title: Small pumpkin
content.subtitle: Your baby has reached his/her full size, which is about the size of a small pumpkin! But don't worry if your baby is not out yet. Only 5% of babies come on the exact due date!

content.title: Medium jackfruit
content.subtitle: Your little one is certainly very comfortable in your womb! Now the size of a medium jackfruit, he or she will be ready to pop out soon!

content.title: Bottle gourd
content.subtitle: At 42 weeks of pregnancy, your baby is still growing, and the size of a bottle gourd. Your pregnancy is now considered "post-term". You may choose to wait until your baby comes out, or you may choose to be induced. Keep in mind that there is a higher chance of stillbirth when a pregnancy lasts longer than 42 weeks.

content.title: Watermelon
content.subtitle: At post-term, your baby is at his/her maximum size and weight. Considering your health and the health of your baby, it is recommended to induce labour or consider a C-section.
